t: Proverbs 19
Better*p is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
Also,*p that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
The*p foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the Lord.*s
Wealth*p maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
A*p false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
Many*p will entreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
All*p the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.
He*p that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
A*p false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
Delight*p is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
The*p discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
The*p king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
A*p foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
House*p and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the Lord.*s
Slothfulness*p casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
He*p that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.
He*p that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord;*s and that which he hath given will he pay him again.
Chasten*p thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
A*p man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
Hear*p counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
There*p are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord,*s that shall stand.
The*p desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.
The*p fear of the Lord*s tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
A*p slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Smite*p a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
He*p that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
Cease,*p my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
An*p ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
Judgments*p are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
